temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.content:
Both Yersinia enterocolitica and Yersinia pseudotuberculosis are psycrotrophic: they can survive at temperatures below +4°C, making refrigerated food susceptible to contamination.

Y. enterocolitica grows at 0-45°C, optimum 25-32°C.
Y. pseudotuberculosis grows at 0-43°C, optimum 25-28°C.

Both are motile by peritrichous flagella at temperatures between 20°C and 30°C (optimum 25°C) and immobile at 37°C.

oxygen.title: Oxygen
oxygen.content: Both Yersinia enterocolitica and Yersinia pseudotuberculosis are facultative anaerobic. Therefore, they can survive with or without oxygen.

ph.title: pH
ph.content:
Yersinia enterocolitica survives at pH between 4.2 and 9.0;
Yersinia pseudotuberculosis survives at pH between 5.0 and 9.6. For both, the optimum pH is 7.6.

humidity.title: Water
humidity.content:
Yersinia enterocolitica: minimum water activity (aw) at which growth occurs is 0.96

Yersinia pseudotuberculosis: information not available

salinity.title: Salinity
salinity.content:
Yersinia enterocolitica: able to grow in environments with up to 5% salt concentration;
Yersinia pseudotuberculosis: able to grow in environments with up to 3.5% salt concentration
